results.title: Morris loves Jack
results.brief_description: An off-beat romance between a policewoman and the charming but feckless unemployed actor who shares her house and her money. She is happy to support him emotionally and financially, in spite of his irresponsible attitude to life until she finds him in the arms of “another”. Cast includes Kris McQuade, John Hargreaves, Bill Hunter, David Boyd.

results.title: Morris loves Jack
results.brief_description: A star studded short drama, Morris Loves Jack is an off-beat romance between Jack, a young policewoman and Morris, the charming but feckless out of work actor who shares her house and her money. She is happy to support him emotionally and financially in spite of his irresponsible attitude to life until she finds him in the arms of another. Starring Kris McQuade and John Hargraves

results.title: Morris's disappearing bag (K)
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel, Weston Woods Studios and Michael Sporn
results.brief_description: An animated children’s story in which Morris receives a bag, for Christmas, which can make him disappear. Based on the book by Rosemary Wells.

results.title: Morning on the Lievre
results.creator_credit: Guy Glover, ONF | NFB and David Bairstow
results.brief_description: Poet Archibald Lampman describes in verse the dazzling beauty of Quebec’s Lievre River as it winds past maple-wooded hills in late September. Every tree is ablaze with colour, and the riot of reds, golds and greens is caught and held in the mirror surfaces of the water. In “Morning on the Lievre” you see the river through the poet’s eyes. Sole accompaniment is the reading of the poem, and music specially composed. (Awards: Eight including Edinburgh; Boston; Brussels)

results.title: Morning in the streets
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Denis Mitchell and Roy Harris
results.brief_description: An impression of life and opinion in the back streets of a northern industrial city in England, showing the warmth, the vitality and humor. In the early morning the streets are drab and wet but gradually they awaken, to human sounds and movements. The film ends at midday when the children come out of school, their shouts and songs drowning the voices of the old. (Award: Italia)

results.title: More than words: cartoons
results.creator_credit: Peter Baroutis, ABC-TV (Australia) and Chris Langman
results.brief_description: More than words is a series which follows Rosa, a young girl, and her friend, a little green creature from another planet. Using Rosa’s imagination, they explore the English language in different circumstances through a number of different texts. In this episode Rosa and the creature explore cartoons and how they are produced. When the little creature believes that cartoon events can translate into real life, Rosa sets out to show him this isn’t the case. They contact a cartoonist who, using current popular cartoons such as “The Simpsons” and “The Flintstones” as examples, explains the characteristics of cartoons, cartoon stereotypes, the basic formula for a storyline, the role music and sound effects play in creating an effective cartoon, and the way cartoon violence cannot translate into actual day activities.

results.title: More than words (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Henry Strauss, Henry Strauss Productions and Marvin Dreyer
results.brief_description: Describes some simple techniques for good communication, to the end that people may know where they stand with one another. Illustrates how failure to give clear instructions can cause misunderstandings, trouble and dissatisfaction to those receiving the instructions.

results.title: More than just trees
results.creator_credit: Barrie Howells, ONF | NFB and Gary Toole
results.brief_description: On his income as an independent woodcutter, Bill Mosher of Charlotte County, New Brunswick, was able to bring up a family of five sons. Some of them have chosen to earn their living in the same way, but they are having a difficult time competing with the large pulp and paper corporations they supply. Today, corporate forestry controls the market. This film describes the situation in New Brunswick, and the steps that are being taken by the independent wood producers to counteract the power of the eleven companies that control the pulp and paper industry.
